block.p: DANA CORP., Toledo, Ohio, the largest maker of light-truck axles in the world, said it planned to sell its Chelsea Power Take-Off unit, a maker of auxiliary power equipment for trucks.

MASTEC INC., Miami, which helps companies build and maintain communications networks, received a five-year contract worth at least $100 million to help build a fiber optic network for the Comcast Corp., Philadelphia, a cable television company.

K-TEL INTERNATIONAL INC., Plymouth, Minn., a retailer of music, said it had been warned by the Nasdaq stock market that it may be delisted because it no longer meets certain minimum requirements.

WINDMERE-DURABLE HOLDINGS INC., Miami Lakes, Fla., a maker of small appliances, said it was changing its name to Applica Inc. and would increase the number of its authorized shares by 88 percent, to 75 million shares.
